definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

sentences.english: The very major problem that Chinese mathematics faces is lack of leadership.
sentences.chinese: 当今中国数学界面对的大难，便是缺乏领导者。

sentences.english: Will you hold hands of your lover when disaster comes?
sentences.chinese: 大难来临时，你会牵住你爱人的手吗？

sentences.english: Couples may seperate from each other while facing troubles.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻本是同林鸟，大难来时各自飞。

sentences.english: He spoke darkly of possible future disaster .
sentences.chinese: 他悲观地说将来可能大难临头。

sentences.english: The emperor expressed appreciation to Xue for helping him survive the disaster and awarded Xue with a royal horse.
sentences.chinese: 躲过大难，唐高宗感激薛仁贵，特赐薛仁贵御马一匹。

sentences.english: If escaping from death, need equestrian desert, in the future good stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 大难不死的话，就需要骑马逃跑，日后好东山再起。

sentences.english: Here I am talkingtummy-rot about civilization, when your Tara's in danger.
sentences.chinese: 你的德园大难临头，我却还在讲什么关于文明的废话。

sentences.english: Those who have survived realize the meaning of life .
sentences.chinese: 那些劫后余生大难不死的人，认识到了生命的意义。

sentences.english: a cat's ability to survive falls is based on fact.
sentences.chinese: 猫在跌落时能够大难不死是有事实作依据的。

sentences.english: The boy, who was unscathed by his ordeal, left the mall with his father.
sentences.chinese: 这名大难不死的男孩儿随后同他的爸爸离开了商场。

sentences.english: A few ruffian begin chummery make a target, only poor clever boy or long-standing.
sentences.chinese: 同宿舍几个光棍开始搞对象了，唯有瘦猴还是老大难。

sentences.english: And they abode there, they and their children, and their wives, and their cattle: because afflictions increased upon them.
sentences.chinese: 将子女妻室牲畜也一同带了去，因为大难已临头上。

sentences.english: To realize the value of one second:Ask a person who has survived an accident.
sentences.chinese: 要想知道一秒钟的价值，那就去问大难不死的人。

sentences.english: It is a long-standing problem in hospital management on professional caregivers.
sentences.chinese: 医院职业陪护一直是医院管理中的老大难问题。

sentences.english: Two other workers attempted to kill themselves by jumping off buildings but survived.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有两名工人跳楼自杀，但大难不死。

definition: to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
